articles.author: AUDREY McAVOY and GENE JOHNSON
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Leola Vierra stepped gingerly among the hardened pools of melted metal, charred wood and broken glass that are almost all that remain of the home where she lived for nearly 50 years.
articles.title: Lahaina family finds cherished heirlooms and devastation in first home visit after deadly wildfire

articles.author: FARID ABDULWAHED
articles.description: MOSUL, Iraq (AP) — A raging fire caused by fireworks set off to celebrate a Christian wedding consumed a hall packed with guests in northern Iraq, killing at least 100 people and injuring 150 others as authorities warned Wednesday the death toll could still rise.
articles.title: A fire at a wedding hall in northern Iraq has killed more than 100 people and injured 150

articles.author: ANDREW DALTON
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Hollywood's writers strike was declared over after nearly five months Tuesday night when board members from their union approved a contract agreement with studios, bringing the industry at least partly back from a historic halt in production.
articles.title: The Hollywood writers strike is over after guild leaders approve contract with studios

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A judge ruled Tuesday that Donald Trump committed fraud for years while building the real estate empire that catapulted him to fame and the White House, and he ordered some of the former president's companies removed from his control and dissolved.
articles.title: Judge rules Donald Trump defrauded banks, insurers while building real estate empire

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Congress is starkly divided over very different paths to preventing a federal shutdown — the Senate charging ahead with a bipartisan package to temporarily fund the government but the House slogging through a longshot effort with no real chance of finishing by Saturday's deadline.
articles.title: Congress says its wants to avoid a shutdown. But the House and Senate are moving even further apart.

articles.author: DANIEL SHAILER
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Chanting from one to 43, relatives of students abducted nine years ago counted out the number of the missing youths as they marched through Mexico City Tuesday to demand answers to one of Mexico's most infamous human rights cases.
articles.title: 9 years later, families of 43 missing Mexican students march to demand answers in emblematic case

articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration on Tuesday suspended most non-humanitarian aid to Gabon after a military takeover in the country last month that was at least the second this year in an African nation.
articles.title: US suspends aid to Gabon after military takeover

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM, TOM KRISHER and CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: VAN BUREN TOWNSHIP, Mich. (AP) — President Joe Biden grabbed a bullhorn on the picket line Tuesday and urged striking auto workers to “stick with it” in an unparalleled show of support for organized labor by a modern president.
articles.title: Biden urges striking auto workers to 'stick with it' in picket line visit unparalleled in history

articles.author: HALELUYA HADERO
articles.description: U.S. regulators and 17 states are suing Amazon over allegations the e-commerce behemoth abuses its position in the marketplace to inflate prices on and off its platform, overcharge sellers and stifle competition.
articles.title: Amazon sued by FTC and 17 states over allegations it inflates online prices and overcharges sellers

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK and JAKE OFFENHARTZ
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Sen. Bob Menendez came under heavy pressure to resign Tuesday as a surging number of his Democratic colleagues in the Senate, including fellow New Jersey Democrat Cory Booker, urged him to step aside over the federal bribery allegations against him.
articles.title: Calls are mounting for Menendez to resign as Democrats grapple with 'shocking' bribery allegations
